net.fec.openrq.parameters

Class FECParameters

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.fec.openrq.parameters.FECParameters

  • public final class FECParameters
extends Object
    This class represents FEC parameters as defined in RFC 6330 as the Encoded FEC Object Transmission Information (OTI), which contains the Encoded Common FEC OTI and the Encoded Scheme-Specific FEC OTI.

    The FEC parameters consist of:

    Source data length
    The length of the source data, in number of bytes. Since encoded data may contain extra padding bytes, this value allows a decoder to infer the real size of the decoded data.
    Symbol size
    The size of a symbol, in number of bytes. This value represents the size of an encoding symbol (source or repair), except the size of the last source symbol, which may be smaller.
    Number of source blocks
    The number of source blocks into which the source data is partitioned. Each source block is encoded/decoded independently, and not every one is divided into the same number of source symbols.
    Interleaver length
    The number of sub-blocks per source block into which the source data is interleaved. This value influences the level of uniform interleaving used before encoding a source block. A value of 1 means no interleaving is used, and a higher value means more interleaving per source block. Interleaving refers to a burst-error correction technique in FEC codes.
    Symbol alignment
    This value has no relevance to the user of OpenRQ, since it is fixed to a value of 1. This parameter exists here only for compliance to the RFC 6330.

    Methods are provided to write instances of this class to arrays of bytes, ByteBuffer objects, serializable objects, DataOutput objects and WritableByteChannel objects. Additionally, static methods are provided to parse/read instances of this class from arrays of bytes, ByteBuffer objects, serializable objects, DataInput objects and ReadableByteChannel objects.

    • Method Detail

      • newParameters

        public static FECParameters newParameters(long dataLen,
                          int symbSize,
                          int numSrcBs)
        Returns a new instance, given specific FEC parameters.

        Note: The symbol alignment parameter "Al" is internally obtained.

        The provided FEC parameters are validated by invoking ParameterChecker.areValidFECParameters(dataLen, symbSize, numSrcBs, interLen), and an IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the parameters are invalid.

        It is possible, a priori, to obtain lower and upper bounds for valid parameter values. If the parameters fall within these bounds, then this method never throws an IllegalArgumentException. For information on how to obtain these bounds, refer to the section on FEC parameters bounds in the ParameterChecker class header.

        Parameters:
        dataLen - The length of the source data, in number of bytes
        symbSize - The size of a symbol, in number of bytes
        numSrcBs - The number of source blocks into which the source data is partitioned
        Returns:
        a new FECParameters instance
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the provided FEC parameters are invalid

      • newParameters

        public static FECParameters newParameters(long dataLen,
                          int symbSize,
                          int numSrcBs,
                          int interLen)
        Returns a new instance, given specific FEC parameters.

        Note: The symbol alignment parameter "Al" is internally obtained.

        The provided FEC parameters are validated by invoking ParameterChecker.areValidFECParameters(dataLen, symbSize, numSrcBs, interLen), and an IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the parameters are invalid.

        It is possible, a priori, to obtain lower and upper bounds for valid parameter values. If the parameters fall within these bounds, then this method never throws an IllegalArgumentException. For information on how to obtain these bounds, refer to the section on FEC parameters bounds in the ParameterChecker class header.

        Parameters:
        dataLen - The length of the source data, in number of bytes
        symbSize - The size of a symbol, in number of bytes
        numSrcBs - The number of source blocks into which the source data is partitioned
        interLen - The interleaver length, in number of sub-blocks per source block
        Returns:
        a new FECParameters instance
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the provided FEC parameters are invalid

      • deriveParameters

        public static FECParameters deriveParameters(long dataLen,
                             int payLen,
                             long maxDBMem)
        Derives FEC parameters from specific deriver parameters.

        • A payload length is required. It is equivalent to the "symbol size" FEC parameter.
        • A maximum size for a block that is decodable in working memory is required. It allows the decoder to work with a limited amount of memory in an efficient way.

        Note: The symbol alignment parameter "Al" is internally obtained.

        The provided parameters are validated by invoking ParameterChecker.areValidDeriverParameters(dataLen, payLen, maxDBMem), and an IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the parameters are invalid.

        It is possible, a priori, to obtain lower and upper bounds for valid parameter values. If the parameters fall within these bounds, then this method never throws an IllegalArgumentException. For information on how to obtain these bounds, refer to the section on Deriver parameters bounds in the ParameterChecker class header.

        Parameters:
        dataLen - A source data length, in number of bytes
        payLen - A payload length, in number of bytes (equivalent to the "symbol size" FEC parameter)
        maxDBMem - A maximum size, in number of bytes, for a block decodable in working memory
        Returns:
        a derived FECParameters instance
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the provided deriver parameters are invalid

      • parse

        public static Parsed<FECParameters> parse(SerializableParameters serParams)
        Parses FEC parameters from the given serializable object.

        The returned container object indicates if the parsing succeeded or failed:

        • If the parsing succeeded, the FEC parameters can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.value()
        • If the parsing failed, the container object will be invalid and the reason for the parsing failure can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.failureReason()
        Parameters:
        serParams - A serializable object containing FEC parameters
        Returns:
        a container object containing FEC parameters or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If serParams is null

      • parse

        public static Parsed<FECParameters> parse(byte[] array)
        Parses FEC parameters from the given array. The parameters bytes in the array must follow the format specified by asArray().

        The FEC parameters will be read, in the array, from position 0 inclusive to position array.length exclusive.

        The returned container object indicates if the parsing succeeded or failed:

        • If the parsing succeeded, the FEC parameters can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.value()
        • If the parsing failed, the container object will be invalid and the reason for the parsing failure can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.failureReason()
        Parameters:
        array - An array of bytes containing FEC parameters
        Returns:
        a container object containing FEC parameters or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the provided array is null

      • parse

        public static Parsed<FECParameters> parse(byte[] array,
                          int offset)
        Parses FEC parameters from the given array. The parameters bytes in the array must follow the format specified by asArray().

        The FEC parameters will be read, in the array, from position offset inclusive to position array.length exclusive.

        The returned container object indicates if the parsing succeeded or failed:

        • If the parsing succeeded, the FEC parameters can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.value()
        • If the parsing failed, the container object will be invalid and the reason for the parsing failure can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.failureReason()
        Parameters:
        array - An array of bytes containing FEC parameters
        offset - The starting index in the array (must be non-negative and less than array.length)
        Returns:
        a container object containing FEC parameters or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the pre-conditions on the array offset do not hold
        NullPointerException - If the provided array is null

      • parse

        public static Parsed<FECParameters> parse(ByteBuffer buffer)
        Parses FEC parameters from the given buffer. The parameters bytes in the buffer must follow the format specified by asBuffer().

        The FEC parameters will be read, in the buffer, from the current position inclusive to the current limit exclusive. If the parsing succeeds, the position of the buffer will have been advanced by 12 bytes.

        The returned container object indicates if the parsing succeeded or failed:

        • If the parsing succeeded, the FEC parameters can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.value()
        • If the parsing failed, the container object will be invalid and the reason for the parsing failure can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.failureReason()
        Parameters:
        buffer - A buffer containing FEC parameters
        Returns:
        a container object containing FEC parameters or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the provided buffer is null

      • readFrom

        public static Parsed<FECParameters> readFrom(DataInput in)
                                      throws IOException
        Reads and parses FEC parameters from a DataInput object. The read parameters bytes must follow the format specified by writeTo(java.io.DataOutput).

        Examples of DataInput objects are DataInputStream and ObjectInputStream.

        The returned container object indicates if the parsing succeeded or failed:

        • If the parsing succeeded, the FEC parameters can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.value()
        • If the parsing failed, the container object will be invalid and the reason for the parsing failure can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.failureReason()

        Blocking behavior: this method blocks until all FEC parameters are read from the input, or a parsing failure is detected, or an IOException is throw.

        Parameters:
        in - A DataInput object from which FEC parameters are read
        Returns:
        a container object containing FEC parameters or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading from the DataInput object
        NullPointerException - If in is null

      • readFrom

        public static Parsed<FECParameters> readFrom(ReadableByteChannel ch)
                                      throws IOException
        Reads and parses FEC parameters from a ReadableByteChannel object. The read parameters bytes must follow the format specified by writeTo(java.nio.channels.WritableByteChannel).

        Examples of ReadableByteChannel objects are SocketChannel and FileChannel.

        The returned container object indicates if the parsing succeeded or failed:

        • If the parsing succeeded, the FEC parameters can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.value()
        • If the parsing failed, the container object will be invalid and the reason for the parsing failure can be retrieved by calling the method Parsed.failureReason()

        Blocking behavior: this method blocks until all FEC parameters are read from the channel, or a parsing failure is detected, or an IOException is throw.

        Parameters:
        ch - A ReadableByteChannel object from which FEC parameters are read
        Returns:
        a container object containing FEC parameters or a parsing failure reason string
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading from the ReadableByteChannel object
        NullPointerException - If ch is null

      • asSerializable

        public SerializableParameters asSerializable()
        Returns a serializable object with these FEC parameters. The serializable object will contain the Common FEC OTI followed by the Scheme-Specific FEC OTI.
        Returns:
        a serializable object with these FEC parameters

      • asArray

        public byte[] asArray()
        Returns an array with these FEC parameters. The array will contain the Common FEC OTI followed by the Scheme-Specific FEC OTI.
        Returns:
        an array with these FEC parameters

      • writeTo

        public void writeTo(byte[] array)
        Writes in the provided array starting at index zero these FEC parameters. The write consists of the Common FEC OTI followed by the Scheme-Specific FEC OTI.

        The provided array must have a length of at least 12 bytes.

        Parameters:
        array - An array on which the FEC parameters are written
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the length of the array is insufficient to hold the FEC parameters
        NullPointerException - If the provided array is null

      • writeTo

        public void writeTo(byte[] array,
           int offset)
        Writes in the provided array starting in a specific index these FEC parameters. The write consists of the Common FEC OTI followed by the Scheme-Specific FEC OTI.

        The provided array must have at least 12 bytes between the given index and its length.

        Parameters:
        array - An array on which the FEC parameters are written
        offset - The starting array index at which the FEC parameters are written (must be non-negative)
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the offset is negative or if the length of the array region starting at the offset is insufficient to hold the FEC parameters
        NullPointerException - If the provided array is null

      • asBuffer

        public ByteBuffer asBuffer()
        Returns a buffer with these FEC parameters. The buffer will contain the Common FEC OTI followed by the Scheme-Specific FEC OTI.
        Returns:
        a buffer with these FEC parameters

      • writeTo

        public void writeTo(ByteBuffer buffer)
        Writes in the provided buffer these FEC parameters. The write consists of the Common FEC OTI followed by the Scheme-Specific FEC OTI.

        The provided buffer must not be read-only, and must have at least 12 bytes remaining. If this method returns normally, the position of the provided buffer will have been advanced by the same amount.

        Parameters:
        buffer - A buffer on which the FEC parameters are written
        Throws:
        ReadOnlyBufferException - If the provided buffer is read-only
        BufferOverflowException - If the provided buffer has less than 12 bytes remaining
        NullPointerException - If the provided buffer is null

      • writeTo

        public void writeTo(DataOutput out)
             throws IOException
        Writes these FEC parameters directly into the provided DataOutput object. The method will write the Common FEC OTI followed by the Scheme-Specific FEC OTI.

        Examples of DataOutput objects are DataOutputStream and ObjectOutputStream.

        Blocking behavior: this method blocks until all FEC parameters are written to the output, or an IOException is throw.

        Parameters:
        out - A DataOutput object into which the FEC parameters are written
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs while writing to the DataOutput object
        NullPointerException - If out is null

      • writeTo

        public void writeTo(WritableByteChannel ch)
             throws IOException
        Writes these FEC parameters directly into the provided WritableByteChannel object. The method will write the Common FEC OTI followed by the Scheme-Specific FEC OTI.

        Examples of WritableByteChannel objects are SocketChannel and FileChannel.

        Blocking behavior: this method blocks until all FEC parameters are written to the channel, or an IOException is throw.

        Parameters:
        ch - A WritableByteChannel object into which the FEC parameters are written
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs while writing to the WritableByteChannel object
        NullPointerException - If ch is null

      • dataLength

        public long dataLength()
        Returns the length of the source data, in number of bytes.

        Since encoded data may contain extra padding bytes, this value allows a decoder to infer the original source data length.

        Returns:
        the length of the source data, in number of bytes

      • symbolSize

        public int symbolSize()
        Returns the size of a symbol, in number of bytes.

        This value represents the size of an encoding symbol (source or repair), except the size of the last source symbol, which may be smaller.

        Returns:
        the size of a symbol, in number of bytes

      • numberOfSourceBlocks

        public int numberOfSourceBlocks()
        Returns the number of source blocks into which the source data is partitioned.

        Each source block is encoded/decoded independently, and not every one is divided into the same number of source symbols.

        Returns:
        the number of source blocks into which the source data is partitioned

      • interleaverLength

        public int interleaverLength()
        Returns the interleaver length, in number of sub-blocks per source block.

        This value influences the level of uniform interleaving used before encoding a source block. A value of 1 means no interleaving is used, and a higher value means more interleaving per source block.

        Returns:
        the interleaver length, in number of sub-blocks per source block

      • symbolAlignment

        public int symbolAlignment()
        Returns the symbol alignment value.

        This value has no relevance to the user of OpenRQ, since it is fixed to a value of 1. This method exists only for completeness purposes.

        Returns:
        the symbol alignment value

      • dataLengthAsInt

        public int dataLengthAsInt()
        Returns the value returned by dataLength() cast to an int, unless the cast causes the data length value to overflow (when dataLength() > Integer.MAX_VALUE).
        Returns:
        the value returned by dataLength() cast to an int
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - If the cast causes the data length value to overflow (when dataLength() > Integer.MAX_VALUE)

      • totalSymbols

        public int totalSymbols()
        Returns the total number of source symbols into which the source data is divided.

        This is a convenience method that simply returns the result of ceiling(dataLength()/symbolSize()).

        Returns:
        the total number of source symbols into which the source data is divided

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object obj)
        Returns true if, and only if, this instance is equal to another object.

        This instance (this) is equal to another object (obj), if and only if:

        • obj is non-null
        • and obj is an instance of FECParameters
        • and this.dataLength() == obj.dataLength()
        • and this.symbolSize() == obj.symbolSize()
        • and this.numberOfSourceBlocks() == obj.numberOfSourceBlocks()
        • and this. interleaverLength() == obj.interleaverLength()
        • and this.symbolAlignment() == obj.symbolAlignment()
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns a hash code value based on all FEC parameters in this instance.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object

        Overrides:
